## Visualizing Ancestry

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

```{r}

setwd("/Users/cmdb/qb25-answers/week3")
library(tidyverse)

gt_long <- read_tsv("/Users/cmdb/qb25-answers/week3/gt_long.txt")

gt_long_filtered <- gt_long %>%
  filter(chrom == "chrII", sample_id == "A01_62")

ggplot(data = gt_long_filtered, aes(x = pos, y = sample_id, color = factor(genotype))) + 
  geom_point() + 
  labs(
    x = "Position along Chromosome II" ,
    y = "" 
    ) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = c("lightblue2" , "lightcoral")) +
  theme_classic()
ggsave("exercise3_singleplot.png")

gt_long_filtered_sample <- gt_long %>%
  filter(sample_id == "A01_62")

ggplot(data = gt_long_filtered_sample, aes(x = pos, y = chrom, color = factor(genotype))) +
  geom_point() + 
  labs(
    x = "Position along Chromosome" ,
    y = "" 
    ) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = c("lightblue2" , "lightcoral")) +
  theme_classic() + 
  facet_grid(sample_id~., scales = "free_x", space = "free_x")
ggsave("exercise3_allchromplot.png")

ggplot(data = gt_long, aes(x = pos, y = chrom, color = factor(genotype))) +
  geom_point() + 
  labs(
    x = "Position along Chromosome" ,
    y = "" 
    ) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = c("lightblue2" , "lightcoral")) +
  theme_classic() + 
  facet_grid(.~sample_id, scales = "free_x", space = "free_x")
ggsave("exercise3_allchromallsampplot.png")

```
